title: Serbian police arrest 7 people smugglers and find over 700 migrants in raids
content: Serbian police say they have found some 3,400 migrants and seized automatic and other weapons during a days-long crackdown on irregular migration after a shooting last week near the border with Hungary that killed three migrants and wounded one
contentSnippet: Serbian police say they have found some 3,400 migrants and seized automatic and other weapons during a days-long crackdown on irregular migration after a shooting last week near the border with Hungary that killed three migrants and wounded one

title: Israel rules out Gaza cease-fire until hostages released, as US presses for aid, civilian protection
content: U_S_ Secretary of State Antony Blinken urged Israel to allow more humanitarian into Gaza and do more to protect Palestinian civilians from its war with Hamas, or else there will be “no partners for peace.”
contentSnippet: U_S_ Secretary of State Antony Blinken urged Israel to allow more humanitarian into Gaza and do more to protect Palestinian civilians from its war with Hamas, or else there will be “no partners for peace.”

title: Myanmar's army chief vows counterattacks on armed groups that captured northeastern border towns
content: The leader of Myanmar’s army-installed government has declared its military will carry out counterattacks against a powerful alliance of ethnic armed groups
contentSnippet: The leader of Myanmar’s army-installed government has declared its military will carry out counterattacks against a powerful alliance of ethnic armed groups

title: North Korean art sells in China despite UN sanctions over nuclear program
content: A Beijing-based art dealer touts itself as China's premier seller of North Korean art, despite stiff U.N. sanctions prohibiting the sale of such goods
contentSnippet: A Beijing-based art dealer touts itself as China's premier seller of North Korean art, despite stiff U.N. sanctions prohibiting the sale of such goods

title: King Charles III meets with religious leaders to promote peace on the final day of his Kenya visit
content: King Charles III has met with religious leaders about promoting peace and security during the last day of his four-day trip to Kenya
contentSnippet: King Charles III has met with religious leaders about promoting peace and security during the last day of his four-day trip to Kenya

title: Storm Ciarán kills 5 people as it brings record rainfall to Italy
content: Record-breaking rain provoked floods in a vast swath of Tuscany as storm Ciarán pushed into Italy overnight
contentSnippet: Record-breaking rain provoked floods in a vast swath of Tuscany as storm Ciarán pushed into Italy overnight

title: Iran puts the death toll from a fire at a drug rehabilitation center at 32
content: A fire at a drug rehabilitation center in northern Iran has killed at least 32 people, according to Iranian state media
contentSnippet: A fire at a drug rehabilitation center in northern Iran has killed at least 32 people, according to Iranian state media

title: Japanese consumers are eating more local fish in spite of China's ban due to Fukushima wastewater
content: Fishing communities in Fukushima feared devastating damage to their businesses from the tsunami-wrecked nuclear power plant’s ongoing discharge of treated radioactive wastewater into the sea
contentSnippet: Fishing communities in Fukushima feared devastating damage to their businesses from the tsunami-wrecked nuclear power plant’s ongoing discharge of treated radioactive wastewater into the sea

title: Investigators are being sent to US research base on Antarctica to look into sexual violence concerns
content: The watchdog office overseeing the National Science Foundation is sending investigators to Antarctica’s McMurdo Station after hearing concerns about the prevalence of sexual violence at the U.S. research base
contentSnippet: The watchdog office overseeing the National Science Foundation is sending investigators to Antarctica’s McMurdo Station after hearing concerns about the prevalence of sexual violence at the U.S. research base

title: AP Week in Pictures: Europe and Africa
content:
Oct. 27 – Nov. 2, 2023

Revelers celebrate Halloween at the West Side Hallo Fest in Romania, storm Ciaran whips Western Europe, blowing record winds in France and UK, and South Africa beats New Zealand to win Rugby World Cup title in Paris.

This gallery highlights some of the most compelling images made or published in the past week by Associated Press photographers in Europe and Africa.

The selection was curated by AP photographer Thibault Camus in France.

___

Follow AP visual journalism:

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/apnews

AP Images on Twitter: http://twitter.com/AP_Images

AP Images blog: http://apimagesblog.com

title: China and Southeast Asia nations vow to conclude a nonaggression pact faster as sea crises escalate
content: Diplomats from Chinese and a Southeast Asian group of nations have renewed a pledge to finalize a nonaggression pact for the South China Sea in three years
contentSnippet: Diplomats from Chinese and a Southeast Asian group of nations have renewed a pledge to finalize a nonaggression pact for the South China Sea in three years

title: AP Week in Pictures: Asia
content:
Oct. 27-Nov. 2, 2023

A student activist resists detention while gathering to protest against Israel’s military operations in Gaza and to support the Palestinian people, in New Delhi. Activists of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party face police during a protest in Dhaka. A devotee lights oil lamps during celebrations of the full moon day of Thadingyut, or lighting festival, to mark the end of Buddhist Lent in Naypyitaw, Myanmar.

This photo gallery highlights some of the most compelling images in Asia made or published by The Associated Press in the past week.

The selection was curated by AP photo editor Masayo Yoshida in Tokyo.

Follow AP visual journalism:

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/apnews

AP Images on Twitter: http://twitter.com/AP_Images

AP Images blog: http://apimagesblog.com
contentSnippet:

A student activist resists detention while gathering to protest against Israel’s military operations in Gaza and to support the Palestinian people, in New Delhi. Activists of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party face police during a protest in Dhaka. A devotee lights oil lamps during celebrations of the full moon day of Thadingyut, or lighting festival, to mark the end of Buddhist Lent in Naypyitaw, Myanmar.

This photo gallery highlights some of the most compelling images in Asia made or published by The Associated Press in the past week.

title: Live updates | Hundreds evacuate Gaza Strip as more pressure placed on Israel to pause fighting
content: Israel ground troops are advancing toward Gaza City as diplomatic efforts intensify for at least a brief pause in the fighting in Gaza’s deadliest war
contentSnippet: Israel ground troops are advancing toward Gaza City as diplomatic efforts intensify for at least a brief pause in the fighting in Gaza’s deadliest war

title: Nigeria's government budgets for SUVs and president's wife while millions struggle to make ends meet
content: Nigeria’s lawmakers have approved the new government’s first supplemental budget, which includes huge allocations for SUVs and houses for the president, his wife and other public officials, sparking anger and criticism from citizens in one of the world...
contentSnippet: Nigeria’s lawmakers have approved the new government’s first supplemental budget, which includes huge allocations for SUVs and houses for the president, his wife and other public officials, sparking anger and criticism from citizens in one of the world...

title: Australia police arrest host of lunch that left 3 dead from suspected poisoning
content: The host of a weekend family lunch at her Australian country home has been charged with murdering her ex-husband's parents and aunt with poisonous mushrooms and attempting to murder a fourth guest
contentSnippet: The host of a weekend family lunch at her Australian country home has been charged with murdering her ex-husband's parents and aunt with poisonous mushrooms and attempting to murder a fourth guest

title: Putin signs bill revoking Russia's ratification of a global nuclear test ban treaty
content: President Vladimir Putin has signed a bill revoking Russia's ratification of a global nuclear test ban
contentSnippet: President Vladimir Putin has signed a bill revoking Russia's ratification of a global nuclear test ban

title: Rwanda announces visa-free travel for all Africans as continent opens up to free movement of people
content: Rwanda announced Thursday that it will allow all Africans to travel visa-free to the country, becoming the latest nation on the continent to announce such a measure aimed at boosting free movement of people
contentSnippet: Rwanda announced Thursday that it will allow all Africans to travel visa-free to the country, becoming the latest nation on the continent to announce such a measure aimed at boosting free movement of people

title: Pakistan's parliament elections delayed till early February as political and economic crises deepen
content: Pakistan’s election oversight body has postponed the country’s upcoming parliament elections for the second time, saying the vote will take place in February
contentSnippet: Pakistan’s election oversight body has postponed the country’s upcoming parliament elections for the second time, saying the vote will take place in February

title: Albania's opposition tries to disrupt a parliament session in protest against ruling Socialists
content: Albanian opposition lawmakers have caused commotion in Parliament, trying to disrupt a session in protest against what they say is increasingly authoritarian rule by the governing Socialists
contentSnippet: Albanian opposition lawmakers have caused commotion in Parliament, trying to disrupt a session in protest against what they say is increasingly authoritarian rule by the governing Socialists

title: Key Swiss rail tunnel damaged by derailment won't fully reopen until next September
content: Switzerland’s national rail operator says the world’s longest rail tunnel won’t be fully reopened to train traffic until next September, again pushing back the target date for repairs of damage caused by a cargo train derailment
contentSnippet: Switzerland’s national rail operator says the world’s longest rail tunnel won’t be fully reopened to train traffic until next September, again pushing back the target date for repairs of damage caused by a cargo train derailment

title: Netanyahu has sidestepped accountability for failing to prevent Hamas attack, instead blaming others
content: A growing list of Israeli officials have accepted responsibility for failing to prevent Hamas’ brutal attack on Israeli communities
contentSnippet: A growing list of Israeli officials have accepted responsibility for failing to prevent Hamas’ brutal attack on Israeli communities

title: Bank of England keeps main UK interest rate unchanged at 15-year high of 5.25%
content: The Bank of England kept its main interest rate unchanged at the 15-year high of 5.25% and indicated that borrowing costs will likely remain at these sort of elevated levels for a while yet especially if oil and gas prices increase sharply because of t...
contentSnippet: The Bank of England kept its main interest rate unchanged at the 15-year high of 5.25% and indicated that borrowing costs will likely remain at these sort of elevated levels for a while yet especially if oil and gas prices increase sharply because of t...

title: 2 more killed as Russian artillery keeps on battering southern Ukraine's Kherson region
content: Russian shelling has killed an 81-year-old woman in the yard of her home and a 60-year-old man in southern Ukraine’s Kherson region
contentSnippet: Russian shelling has killed an 81-year-old woman in the yard of her home and a 60-year-old man in southern Ukraine’s Kherson region

title: North Korea likely sent missiles, ammunition and shells to Russia, Seoul says
content: South Korea says North Korea has likely supplied several types of missiles to Russia to support its war in Ukraine, along with its widely reported shipments of ammunition and shells
contentSnippet: South Korea says North Korea has likely supplied several types of missiles to Russia to support its war in Ukraine, along with its widely reported shipments of ammunition and shells

title: Asia's first Gay Games to kick off in Hong Kong, fostering hopes for wider LGBTQ+ inclusion
content: Hong Kong is set to launch Asia's first Gay Games on Friday, fostering hopes for wider LGBTQ+ inclusion in the Asian financial hub
contentSnippet: Hong Kong is set to launch Asia's first Gay Games on Friday, fostering hopes for wider LGBTQ+ inclusion in the Asian financial hub

title: Israeli military tour of northern Gaza reveals ravaged buildings, toppled trees, former weapons lab
content: International journalists escorted by the Israeli military got a glimpse of the devastation wrought by nearly two weeks of heavy fighting in the northern Gaza Strip
contentSnippet: International journalists escorted by the Israeli military got a glimpse of the devastation wrought by nearly two weeks of heavy fighting in the northern Gaza Strip

title: A Russian missile hits a Liberia-flagged ship in Odesa, Ukraine's main Black Sea port
content: A Russian missile strike on the Ukrainian port of Odesa has hit a Liberian-flagged freighter, killing a port worker and wounding another, as well as three citizens of the Philippines, crew members on the ship
contentSnippet: A Russian missile strike on the Ukrainian port of Odesa has hit a Liberian-flagged freighter, killing a port worker and wounding another, as well as three citizens of the Philippines, crew members on the ship

title: Nigeria's president signs controversial bill for a presidential yacht and SUVs for lawmakers
content: Nigeria's president has signed a controversial bill that earmarks $6.1 million for a presidential yacht and millions more for sport utility vehicles for his wife and other top government officials
contentSnippet: Nigeria's president has signed a controversial bill that earmarks $6.1 million for a presidential yacht and millions more for sport utility vehicles for his wife and other top government officials

title: France's Macron opens Gaza aid conference with appeal to Israel to protect civilians
content: French President Emmanuel Macron has opened a Gaza aid conference with an appeal for Israel to protect civilians, saying that “all lives have equal worth” and that fighting terrorism “can never be carried out without rules.”
contentSnippet: French President Emmanuel Macron has opened a Gaza aid conference with an appeal for Israel to protect civilians, saying that “all lives have equal worth” and that fighting terrorism “can never be carried out without rules.”

title: The UK's interior minister sparks furor by accusing police of favoring pro-Palestinian protesters

contentSnippet: Britain’s interior minister has accused the country’s largest police force of being more lenient toward pro-Palestinian demonstrators than other groups

title: Japanese automaker Nissan's profits zoom on strong sales, favorable exchange rates
content: Nissan has reported that its profit zoomed more than 10-fold in the last quarter from a year before, boosted by a weak Japanese yen and strong vehicle sales around the world
contentSnippet: Nissan has reported that its profit zoomed more than 10-fold in the last quarter from a year before, boosted by a weak Japanese yen and strong vehicle sales around the world

title: India, Pakistan border guards trade fire along frontier in Kashmir; one killed
content: Indian and Pakistani soldiers have exchanged gunfire and shelling along their highly militarized frontier in disputed Kashmir, killing an Indian border guard
contentSnippet: Indian and Pakistani soldiers have exchanged gunfire and shelling along their highly militarized frontier in disputed Kashmir, killing an Indian border guard

title: Profits slip at Japan's Sony, hit by lengthy Hollywood strike
content: Sony has reported that its profit in the July-September quarter slipped 29% from a year earlier, as damage from a strike in the movie sector offset boosts from a favorable exchange rate
contentSnippet: Sony has reported that its profit in the July-September quarter slipped 29% from a year earlier, as damage from a strike in the movie sector offset boosts from a favorable exchange rate

contentSnippet: South Pacific leaders are heading to the stunning island of Aitutaki to discuss climate change and other regional concerns

title: Japanese automaker Honda reports its 3Q profit jumped on strong demand at home and in the US
content: Honda has reported that its profit jumped 34% in the July-September quarter from a year earlier as a cheap yen helped boost the Japanese automaker’s overseas strong earnings thanks to healthy demand, especially in the U.S. Honda’s profit rose to 254 bi...
contentSnippet: Honda has reported that its profit jumped 34% in the July-September quarter from a year earlier as a cheap yen helped boost the Japanese automaker’s overseas strong earnings thanks to healthy demand, especially in the U.S. Honda’s profit rose to 254 bi...

title: Costa Rica's $6 million National Bank heist was an inside job, authorities say
content: Little by little an employee of Costa Rica’s National Bank took advantage of a surveillance blindspot to slip more than $6 million worth of currency into envelopes and casually walk out of the country’s largest bank
contentSnippet: Little by little an employee of Costa Rica’s National Bank took advantage of a surveillance blindspot to slip more than $6 million worth of currency into envelopes and casually walk out of the country’s largest bank

title: International Monetary Fund warns Europe against prematurely declaring victory over inflation
content: The International Monetary Fund says the European Central Bank and other policymakers across Europe need to keep interest rates at current elevated levels until they’re sure inflation is under control despite sluggish growth
contentSnippet: The International Monetary Fund says the European Central Bank and other policymakers across Europe need to keep interest rates at current elevated levels until they’re sure inflation is under control despite sluggish growth

title: Azerbaijan's president addresses a military parade in Karabakh and says 'we showed the whole world'

title: Royal pomp and ceremony planned for South Korean president's state visit to the UK

contentSnippet: King Charles III has immersed himself in London’s vibrant Korean scene before the state visit later this month of South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol

title: Pakistan says nearly 25,000 Afghans waiting for visas to US won't be deported as part of clampdown
content: Pakistan’s prime minister has sought to reassure at least 25,000 Afghans waiting in Pakistan for resettlement in the United States that they won’t be deported as part of his government’s widely criticized crackdown on undocumented migrants in the country
contentSnippet: Pakistan’s prime minister has sought to reassure at least 25,000 Afghans waiting in Pakistan for resettlement in the United States that they won’t be deported as part of his government’s widely criticized crackdown on undocumented migrants in the country

contentSnippet: Ukraine, Moldova and Georgia are moving forward in their quests to join the European Union

title: Kosovo says it is setting up an institute to document Serbia's crimes in the 1998-1999 war
content: Kosovo's prime minister said the country is setting up an institute to document Serbia’s crimes against its population in the 1998-1999 war
contentSnippet: Kosovo's prime minister said the country is setting up an institute to document Serbia’s crimes against its population in the 1998-1999 war

title: 21 Syrian pro-government militiamen killed in overnight ambush by Islamic State group, reports say

title: Prince William hopes to expand his Earthshot Prize into a global environment movement by 2030
content: Britain’s Prince William is looking to expand his Earthshot Prize program into a global movement to bolster environmental solutions and galvanize governments to be more engaged in green sectors so that climate change would be easier to tackle
contentSnippet: Britain’s Prince William is looking to expand his Earthshot Prize program into a global movement to bolster environmental solutions and galvanize governments to be more engaged in green sectors so that climate change would be easier to tackle

title: Cambodia deports 25 Japanese nationals suspected of operating online scams

contentSnippet: Twenty-five Japanese nationals suspected of involvement in a cyberscam operation based in Cambodia have been deported to Japan

title: Australian court considers overturning mother's convictions for killing 4 children
content: An Australian court will consider overturning a woman’s convictions for killing her four children
contentSnippet: An Australian court will consider overturning a woman’s convictions for killing her four children

title: More Bukele critics join effort seeking to nullify El Salvador leader's candidacy for reelection
content: As El Salvador President Nayib Bukele seeks reelection, a growing number of voices have called for electoral authorities to annul the populist leader’s candidacy, arguing that it’s a clear violation of the country’s constitution
contentSnippet: As El Salvador President Nayib Bukele seeks reelection, a growing number of voices have called for electoral authorities to annul the populist leader’s candidacy, arguing that it’s a clear violation of the country’s constitution
